activity.title: beckn/protocol-server#259
activity.text:
- Implemented secure /on_subscribe endpoint with sodium-based cryptographic signing
- Added subscriber ID validation and comprehensive logging system
- Created Base64 key format validation and conversion mechanism
- Successfully integrated challenge-response verification flow

activity.title: beckn/protocol-server#260
activity.text:
- Created a new automation script generate-verification-html.js that generates the required verify.html file for network participant domain verification, streamlining the participant onboarding process.
- The script ensures standardized domain ownership verification, reducing manual errors and improving security compliance.
- This automation reduces the participant registration time and provides clear instructions for domain verification setup.

activity.title: beckn/beckn-utilities#280
activity.text:
## Schema Diagram

``` mermaid
erDiagram
    USER {
        number id
        string username
        string fullname
        string password
        enum account_status
        string phone_number
        number updater_id
        timestamp updated_at
        number creator_id
        timestamp created_at
        boolean email_verified
        string verification_token
        number role_id
        string email
        string alternate_phone_number
    }

    ROLES {
        string name
        string id
        string updater_id
        string creator_id
        datetime updated_at
        datetime created_at
    }

    NETWORK_PARTICIPANTS {
        string key_id
        string created
        string city_code
        string valid_from
        string type
        string nonce
        string url
        string country_code
        string signing_public_key
        string subscriber_id
        string valid_until
        string domain
        string encr_public_key
        string updated
        string status
        string id
        string updater_id
        string creator_id
        boolean kyc_complete
    }

    USER_NETWORK_PARTICIPANTS {
        string participant_id
        string user_id
        string id
    }

    NETWORK_DOMAINS {
        string name
        string description
        string schema_url
        string id
    }

    USER ||--o{ USER_NETWORK_PARTICIPANTS : "has participants"
    ROLES ||--o{ USER : "assigned to"
    NETWORK_PARTICIPANTS ||--o{ USER_NETWORK_PARTICIPANTS : "has users"
    NETWORK_DOMAINS ||--o{ NETWORK_PARTICIPANTS : "has participants"
```

activity.title: beckn/beckn-utilities#280
activity.text:
## Prerequisites on protocol server

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Prepare Request Payload] --> B[Save JSON to scripts/data/network-participant.json]
    B --> C[Run Command: npm run generate-verification]
    C --> D[Generate verification.html]
    D --> E[Verify File Exists at public/verification.html]
    
    style A fill:#ffe0b2,stroke:#333
    style B fill:#ffd54f,stroke:#333
    style C fill:#aed581,stroke:#333
    style D fill:#81c784,stroke:#333
    style E fill:#4db6ac,stroke:#333
```

# Network Participant Verification Guide

## Prerequisites
- Node.js and npm installed
- Access to the protocol-server-bap-network directory
- Required dependencies installed (`npm install`)

## Steps

### 1. Prepare Request Payload
Create a JSON file at `scripts/data/network-participant.json` with the following structure:

```json
{
  "subscriber_id": "178f3-2401-4900-1c9a-941d-4d3e-d696-3cc2-145d.ngrok-free.app",
  "url": "https://178f3-2401-4900-1c9a-941d-4d3e-d696-3cc2-145d.ngrok-free.app",
  "type": "BAP",
  "domain": "mobility",
  "location": {
    "city": {
      "name": "Bangalore",
      "code": "BLR"
    },
    "country": {
      "name": "India",
      "code": "IN"
    }
  },
  "key_id": "3fa85f64-5717-4562-b3fc-2c963f66afa6",
  "signing_public_key": "YOUR_SIGNING_PUBLIC_KEY",
  "encr_public_key": "YOUR_ENCRYPTION_PUBLIC_KEY",
  "valid_from": "2025-03-18T16:36:08.651Z",
  "valid_until": "2026-03-18T16:36:08.651Z",
  "status": "INITIATED",
  "created": "2025-03-18T16:36:08.651Z",
  "updated": "2025-03-18T16:36:08.651Z",
  "nonce": "3fa85f64-5717-4562-b3fc-2c963f66afa6"
}
```

### 2. Generate Verification File
Run the following command from the `protocol-server` directory:

```bash
npm run generate-verification
```

This will execute the `scripts/generate-verification-html` script which will:
- Read the network participant data
- Generate the digital signature
- Create the verification.html file

### 3. Verify Output
The verification file should be generated at `public/verification.html`. The file should contain:
- A meta tag with the site verification content
- The verification content should be base64 encoded
- The content should include all the network participant details

### 4. Manual Verification
1. Navigate to the `public` directory
2. Confirm that `verification.html` exists
3. Open the file in a browser to verify it displays correctly
4. Check that the meta tag contains the correct verification content

## Troubleshooting
If you encounter any issues:
1. Ensure all required dependencies are installed
2. Verify the network-participant.json file is properly formatted
3. Check the script execution logs for any errors
4. Confirm you have write permissions in the public directory

## Notes
- The verification file is crucial for network participant registration
- Keep the network-participant.json file secure as it contains sensitive information
- The generated verification.html file should be publicly accessible
- The verification content should match the network participant details exactly

activity.title: beckn/beckn-utilities#280
activity.text:
## Security Architecture Diagram

```mermaid
graph TD
    subgraph Registry[Registry Server]
        R1[Subscribe & Validate]
        R2[Challenge & Verify]
    end

    subgraph Subscriber[Protocol Server]
        S1[Server with SSL Certificate]
        S2[Domain with verify.html]
        S3[Public/Private Keys]
    end

    R1 -->| Validate SSL Certificate| S1
    R1 -->| Verify Domain Ownership| S2
    S3 -->| Share Public Key| R2
    R2 -->| Send Random Challenge| S3
    S3 -->| Return Signed Response| R2

    style R1 fill:#bbf,stroke:#333
    style R2 fill:#bbf,stroke:#333
    style S1 fill:#f9f,stroke:#333
    style S2 fill:#f9f,stroke:#333
    style S3 fill:#f9f,stroke:#333
    style Registry fill:#eef,stroke:#333
    style Subscriber fill:#fff0f5,stroke:#333
```

activity.title: beckn/beckn-utilities#280
activity.text:
## User and Network Participant Onboarding Data Flow Diagram

```mermaid
flowchart TB
  %% External Entity
  User[User]

  %% User Inputs (Data Flows)
  UnamePass1[[username, password]]
  UnamePass2[[username, password]]
  NPInput[[subscriber_id, url, key_id, signing_public_key, encr_public_key, valid_from, valid_until]]

  %% Processes
  Register[Process: User Registration]
  Login[Process: User Login]
  FillForm[Process: Fill Network Participant Info]
  SubscribeAPI[Process: Subscribe API]
  Verify[Process: Verification subscriber_id & URL]
  SaveDeDi[Process: Save to DeDi]

  %% Data Stores
  StrapiDB[(Strapi DB)]
  DeDiDB[(DeDi Storage)]

  %% Data Flows
  User --> UnamePass1 --> Register
  Register --> StrapiDB

  User --> UnamePass2 --> Login
  Login --> StrapiDB

  User --> NPInput --> FillForm
  FillForm --> SubscribeAPI

  SubscribeAPI --> Verify
  Verify -->|If valid| SaveDeDi
  SaveDeDi --> DeDiDB
  Verify -->|If invalid| Error[Error Message to User]
```

activity.title: beckn/beckn-utilities#280
activity.text:
## Logical Architecture Diagram

```mermaid
graph TB
  UI[User Interface]
  
  subgraph Application Layer in Strapi
    Auth[Authentication Module]
    Profile[Profile Management]
    NPManager[Network Participant Manager]
    RoleManager[Role Management]
    DomainManager[Network Domain Management]
    SubscribeAPI[Subscribe API]
    LookupAPI[Lookup API]
  end

  subgraph Data Layer
    StrapiDB[(Strapi Database)]
    DeDi[(DeDi Storage)]
  end

  UI --> Auth
  UI --> Profile
  UI --> NPManager
  UI --> RoleManager
  UI --> DomainManager

  Auth --> StrapiDB
  Profile --> StrapiDB
  RoleManager --> StrapiDB
  DomainManager --> StrapiDB

  NPManager --> SubscribeAPI
  NPManager --> LookupAPI

  SubscribeAPI --> Verification[Verification Logic]
  Verification --> DeDi

  LookupAPI --> DeDi

```

activity.title: beckn/beckn-utilities#280
activity.text:
## Lookup API Flow Diagram

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Start Lookup Request] --> B[Receive LookupRequest Body]
    B --> C[Query Directory in DEDI]
    C --> D[Filter Records based on criteria]
    D --> E{Records Found?}
    E -->|Yes| F[Transform Records]
    E -->|No| G[Return Empty Records]
    F --> H[Map Record Details]
    H --> I[Return Response with Records]
    G --> I
    I --> J[End]
```

activity.title: beckn/protocol-server#252
activity.text:
This implementation introduces a **streaming response mechanism** for search requests. When `streamOnSearch` is enabled, responses will be streamed **in real-time** instead of being stored in `SyncCache`. This improves response times and allows clients to process data incrementally.

### **1. Configuration Update**  
- A new configuration flag `streamOnSearch` is introduced under `app` settings.
- When `streamOnSearch: true`, the system **streams responses** instead of storing them in the cache.

### **2. Emitting Search Event**
- When streaming is enabled, responses are emitted using `eventBus`:
  - If streaming is enabled, `onSearch` event is emitted.  
  - If disabled, the response is stored in `SyncCache`.

- **Opens a streaming connection** when `streamOnSearch` is enabled.  
- **Listens to `onSearch` event** and writes responses **as they arrive**.  
- **Ends the stream** after the `waitTime` timeout.  

## **Testing & Validation**
- **Enable `streamOnSearch: true`** and verify **real-time responses** are streamed.
- **Disable `streamOnSearch: false`** and confirm responses are retrieved from `SyncCache`.
- Validate proper event cleanup to prevent memory leaks.
